remarks:
Define the domain of a class.  Definition 3 of [Suppes] p. 59.  For example, ` F = { <. 2 , 6 >. , <. 3 , 9 >. } -> dom F = { 2 , 3 } ` ( ~ ex-dm ).  Another example is the domain of the complex arctangent, ` ( A e. dom arctan <-> ( A e. CC /\ A =/= -u _i /\ A =/= _i ) ) ` (for proof see ~ atandm ).  Contrast with range (defined in ~ df-rn ).  For alternate definitions see ~ dfdm2 , ~ dfdm3 , and ~ dfdm4 .  The notation " ` dom ` " is used by Enderton; other authors sometimes use script D. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1994.) 

---

 Define the domain of a class.  Definition 3 of [Suppes] p. 59.  For example, F = { ` <. ` 2 , 6 ` >. ` , ` <. ` 3 , 9 ` >. ` } ` -> ` dom F = { 2 , 3 } .  Contrast with range (defined in ~ df-rn ).  For alternate definitions see ~ dfdm2 , ~ dfdm3 , and ~ dfdm4 .  The notation " ` dom ` " is used by Enderton; other authors sometimes use script D. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1994.)
statement:
df-dm $p |- dom A = { x | E. y x A y } $.
$d A x y $.
